This method directly mapped to the .

member.name: M:WixSharp.UI.Forms.ManagedForm.OnShellChanged
member.summary: Called when Shell is changed. It is a good place to initialize the dialog to reflect the MSI session (e.g. localize the view).

member.summary: Called when MSI execution is complete.

member.name: M:WixSharp.UI.Forms.ManagedForm.Localize
member.summary:
Localizes the form and its contained from the specified localization delegate 'localize'.
The method substitutes both localization file (*.wxl) entries and MSI properties contained by the input string with their translated/converted values.
Note that both localization entries and MSI properties must be enclosed in the square brackets (e.g. "[ProductName] Setup", "[InstallDirDlg_Title]").

member.name: P:WixSharp.UI.ManagedUI.Resources.WixSharp_LicenceFile
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\nouicompat\deflang3081{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss\fprq2\fcharset0 Tahoma;}{\f1\fnil\fcharset0 Calibri;}} {\*\generator Riched20 6.3.9600}\viewkind4\uc1 \pard\b\f0\fs22\lang1033 Common Public License Version 1.0\par \b0\fs20\par THE ACCOMPANYING PROGRAM IS PROVIDED UNDER THE TERMS OF THIS COMMON PUBLIC LICENSE ("AGREEMENT"). ANY USE, REPRODUCTION OR DISTRIBUTION OF THE PROGRAM CONSTITUTES RECIPIENT'S ACCEPTANCE OF THIS AGREEMENT.\par \par \par 1. DEFINITIONS \par \par "Contri [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.summary: The ISession interface controls the installation process.

member.summary: Gets or sets the string value of a named installer property.

member.summary: The session context object.

member.name: P:WixSharp.ISession.Features
member.summary: Returns a collection of FeatureItem

member.name: M:WixSharp.ISession.Property(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns the value of the named property of the specified object.
It can be uses as a generic way of accessing the properties as it redirects (transparently) access to the if the session is terminated (e.g. in deferred custom actions).

member.name: M:WixSharp.ISession.GetResourceBitmap(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the resource bitmap.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ISession.GetResourceData(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the resource data.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ISession.GetResourceString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the resource string.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ISession.GetDirectoryPath(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the target system directory path based on specified directory name.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ISession.IsInstalling
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether the product is being installed.
This method will fail to retrieve the correct value if called from the deferred custom action and the session properties that it depends on are not preserved with 'UsesProperties' or 'DefaultUsesProperties'.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ISession.IsRepairing
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether the MSI is running in Repair mode.
This method will fail to retrieve the correct value if called from the deferred custom action and the session properties that it depends on are not preserved with 'UsesProperties' or 'DefaultUsesProperties'.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ISession.IsUninstalling
member.summary:
Determines whether MSI is running in "uninstalling" mode.
This method will fail to retrieve the correct value if called from the deferred custom action and the session properties that it depends on are not preserved with 'UsesProperties' or 'DefaultUsesProperties'.

member.summary: Writes a message to the log, if logging is enabled.
member.param: The line to be written to the log

member.summary: Gets the log file.

member.name: T:WixSharp.ManagedUI
member.summary:
Implements as standard dialog-based MSI embedded UI.
This class allows defining separate sequences of UI dialogs for 'install' and 'modify' MSI executions. The dialog sequence can contain any mixture of built-in standard dialogs and/or custom dialogs (Form inherited from ).

member.name: P:WixSharp.ManagedUI.DefaultWpf
member.summary: The default WPF implementation of ManagedUI. It implements all major dialogs of a typical MSI UI.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ManagedUI.Default
member.summary: The default WinForm implementation of ManagedUI. It implements all major dialogs of a typical MSI UI.

member.name: F:WixSharp.ManagedUI.Empty
member.summary: The default implementation of ManagedUI with no UI dialogs.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ManagedUI.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ManagedUI.BeforeBuild(WixSharp.ManagedProject)
member.summary: This method is called (indirectly) by Wix# compiler just before building the MSI. It allows embedding UI specific resources (e.g. license file, properties) into the MSI.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ManagedUI.ValidateUITextFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validates the UI text file (localization file) for being compatible with ManagedUI.
member.param: if set to true [throw on error].

member.name: P:WixSharp.ManagedUI.InstallDirId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the 'installdir' (destination folder) directory. It is the directory, which is bound to the input UI elements of the Browse dialog (e.g. WiX BrowseDlg, Wix# InstallDirDialog).

member.name: P:WixSharp.ManagedUI.InstallDialogs
member.summary: Sequence of the dialogs to be displayed during the installation of the product.

member.name: P:WixSharp.ManagedUI.ModifyDialogs
member.summary: Sequence of the dialogs to be displayed during the customization of the installed product.

member.name: P:WixSharp.ManagedUI.Icon
member.summary: A window icon that appears in the left top corner of the UI shell window.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ManagedUI.Initialize(Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Session,System.String,Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.InstallUIOptions@)
member.summary: Initializes the specified session.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ManagedUI.ProcessMessage(Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.InstallMessage,Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Record,Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.MessageButtons,Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.MessageIcon,Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.MessageDefaultButton)
member.summary: Processes information and progress messages sent to the user interface.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ManagedUI.Shutdown
member.summary: Shuts down the embedded UI at the end of the installation.
member.remarks:
If the installation was canceled during initialization, this method will not be called. If the installation was canceled or failed at any later point, this method will be called at the end.
Win32 MSI API: ShutdownEmbeddedUI

member.name: T:WixSharp.ShowClrDialogAction
member.summary:
Defines WiX Managed CustomAction.
Managed CustomAction can be defined either in the Wix# script or in the external assembly or C# file. The only requirements for any C# method to be qualified for being Managed CustomAcyion is to have DTF Action signature public static ActionResult MyManagedAction(Session session), and be marked with [CustomAction] attribute.
If Managed CustomAction depends on any assembly, which will not be registered with GAC on the target system such assembly needs to be listed in the .
often needs to be executed with the elevated privileges. Thus after instantiation it will have set to false and set to Execute.deferred to allow elevating.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ShowClrDialogAction.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ShowClrDialogAction.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with properties/fields initialized with specified parameters.
member.param: Name of the CustomAction. The name should match the method implementing the custom action functionality.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ShowClrDialogAction.#ctor(WixSharp.Id,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with properties/fields initialized with specified parameters.
member.param: The explicit to be associated with instance.
Name of the CustomAction. The name should match the method implementing the custom action functionality.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ShowClrDialogAction.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with properties/fields initialized with specified parameters.
member.param: Name of the CustomAction. The name should match the method implementing the custom action functionality.
Path to the assembly containing the CustomAction implementation. Specify "%this%" if the assembly is in the Wix# script.

member.name: M:WixSharp.ShowClrDialogAction.#ctor(WixSharp.Id,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with properties/fields initialized with specified parameters.
member.param: The explicit to be associated with instance.
Name of the CustomAction. The name should match the method implementing the custom action functionality.
Path to the assembly containing the CustomAction implementation. Specify "%this%" if the assembly is in the Wix# script.

member.summary: Starts the execution of the MSI installation.

member.summary: Cancels the execution of the MSI installation, which is already started (progress is displayed).

member.summary: Localization map.

member.name: M:WixSharp.InstallerRuntime.#ctor(WixSharp.ISession)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:WixSharp.InstallerRuntime.GetMsiBitmap(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the bitmap from the MSI embedded resources ('Binary' table).

member.name: M:WixSharp.InstallerRuntime.Localize(System.String)
member.summary:
Localizes the specified text.
The localization is performed according two possible scenarios. The method will return the match form the MSI embedded localization file. However if it cannot find the match the method will try to find the and return the match from the MSI session properties.
This method is mainly used by 'LocalizeWith' extension for a single step localization of WinForm controls.

member.name: F:WixSharp.InstallerRuntime.ProductName
member.summary: The product name

member.name: P:WixSharp.InstallerRuntime.InstallDir
member.summary: The directory the product is to be installed. This field will contain a valid path only after the MSI execution started.

member.name: F:WixSharp.InstallerRuntime.ProductCode
member.summary: The product code

member.name: F:WixSharp.InstallerRuntime.ProductVersion
member.summary: The product version

member.name: T:WixSharp.ResourcesData
member.summary: Localization map. It is nothing else but a specialized version of a generic string-to-string Dictionary.

member.summary: Initializes from WiX localization data (*.wxl).

member.name: T:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentBootstrapperApplication
member.summary:
Defines Wix# bootstrapper managed application with no User Interface.
It is a design time 'adapter' for the canonical WiX managed bootstrapper application .
automatically handles events and detects the current package/product state (present vs. absent). The package state detection is based on the . If this member is no t then the Id of the lats package in the Bundle will be used instead.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentBootstrapperApplication.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentBootstrapperApplication.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentBootstrapperApplication.AutoGenerateSources(System.String)
member.summary: Automatically generates required sources files for building the Bootstrapper. It is used to automatically generate the files which, can be generated automatically without user involvement (e.g. BootstrapperCore.config).

member.name: P:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentBootstrapperApplication.DowngradeWarningMessage
member.summary:
Gets or sets the downgrade warning message. The message is displayed when bundle detects a newer version of primary package is installed and the setup is about to exit.
The default value is "A later version of the package (PackageId: {0}) is already installed. Setup will now exit.".

member.name: T:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentManagedBA
member.summary: Implements canonical WiX managed bootstrapper application without any UI.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentManagedBA.Run
member.summary: Entry point that is called when the Bootstrapper application is ready to run.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentManagedBA.OnPlanComplete(System.Object,Microsoft.Tools.WindowsInstallerXml.Bootstrapper.PlanCompleteEventArgs)
member.summary: Method that gets invoked when the Bootstrapper PlanComplete event is fired. If the planning was successful, it instructs the Bootstrapper Engine to install the packages.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentManagedBA.OnDetectPackageComplete(System.Object,Microsoft.Tools.WindowsInstallerXml.Bootstrapper.DetectPackageCompleteEventArgs)
member.summary: Method that gets invoked when the Bootstrapper DetectPackageComplete event is fired. Checks the PackageId and sets the installation scenario. The PackageId is the ID specified in one of the package elements (msipackage, exepackage, msppackage, msupackage) in the WiX bundle.

member.name: M:WixSharp.Bootstrapper.SilentManagedBA.OnApplyComplete(System.Object,Microsoft.Tools.WindowsInstallerXml.Bootstrapper.ApplyCompleteEventArgs)
member.summary: Method that gets invoked when the Bootstrapper ApplyComplete event is fired. This is called after a bundle installation has completed. Make sure we updated the view.

member.name: M:WixSharp.UIExtensions.GetDirectoryPath(Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Session,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the target system directory path based on specified directory name (MSI Directory table).

member.name: M:WixSharp.UIExtensions.LocalizeWith(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Func{System.String,System.String})
member.summary:
Localizes the control its contained from the specified localization delegate 'localize'.
The method substitutes both localization file (*.wxl) entries and MSI properties contained by the input string with their translated/converted values.
Note that both localization entries and MSI properties must be enclosed in the square brackets (e.g. "[ProductName] Setup", "[InstallDirDlg_Title]").

member.name: M:WixSharp.UIExtensions.LocalizeWith(System.String,System.Func{System.String,System.String})
member.summary:
Localizes the string from the specified localization delegate 'localize'.
The method substitutes both localization file (*.wxl) entries and MSI properties contained by the input string with their translated/converted values.
Note that both localization entries and MSI properties must be enclosed in the square brackets (e.g. "[ProductName] Setup", "[InstallDirDlg_Title]").

member.name: T:WixSharp.IUIContainer
member.summary: Interface of the main window implementation of the MSI external/embedded UI. This interface is designed to be used by Wix#/MSI runtime (e.g. ManagedUI). It is the interface that is directly bound to the (e.g. ).

F:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.session
member.summary: The MSI session

member.name: F:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.hostWindow
member.summary: The WIN32 handle to the host window (parent MSI dialog).

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
This constructor is to be used by the Visual Studio Form designer only. You should always use WixCLRDialog(Session session) constructor instead.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.#ctor(Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Session)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.Init
member.summary: Inits this instance.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.GetMsiForegroundWindow
member.summary: Gets the msi foreground window.

member.name: F:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.delta
member.summary:
There is some strange resizing artifact (at least on Win7) when MoveWindow does not resize the window accurately. Thus special adjustment ('delta') is needed to fix the problem.
The delta value is used in the ReplaceHost method.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.ReplaceHost
member.summary:
'Replaces' the current step dialog with the "itself".
It uses WIN32 API to hide the parent native MSI dialog and place managed form dialog (itself) at the same desktop location and with the same size as the parent.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.RestoreHost
member.summary: Restores parent native MSI dialog after the previous ReplaceHost call.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.MSICancel
member.summary: Closes the dialog and sets the this.DialogResult to the 'DialogResult.Cancel' value ensuring the setup is canceled.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.MSIBack
member.summary: Closes the dialog and sets the this.DialogResult to the 'DialogResult.Retry' value ensuring the setup is resumed with the previous UI sequence dialog is displayed.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.MSINext
member.summary: Closes the dialog and sets the this.DialogResult to the 'DialogResult.OK' value ensuring the setup is resumed and the UI sequence advanced to the next step.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.ShowAsMsiDialog(WixSharp.WixCLRDialog)
member.summary:
Shows as specified managed dialog.
It uses WIN32 API to hide the parent native MSI dialog and place managed form dialog at the same desktop location and with the same size as the parent.
It also ensures that after the managed dialog is closed the proper ActionResult is returned.

member.name: M:WixSharp.WixCLRDialog.GetMSIBinaryStream(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the embedded MSI binary stream.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Deployment.Samples.EmbeddedUI.InstallProgressCounter
member.summary: Tracks MSI progress messages and converts them to usable progress.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Deployment.Samples.EmbeddedUI.InstallProgressCounter.Progress
member.summary: Gets a number between 0 and 1 that indicates the overall installation progress.
